roleset.name: get rid of, make illegal, act of doing away with something

role.descr: entity getting rid of, outlawing something

example.name: abolish-v: typical usage
example.text: Secretary of State for Trade and Industry Nicholas Ridley said later in the day that the government would abolish its golden share in Jaguar , the luxury auto maker being stalked by General Motors and Ford Motor .

propbank.arg: its golden share in Jaguar , the luxury auto maker being stalked by General Motors and Ford Motor

example.name: abolition-n: Arg1, of-phrase
example.text: They first insisted that the abolition of the slave - trade would ruin the colonies .

example.name: abolition-n: All arguments
example.text: It mentions the British celebrated their abolition of slave trade last year .

roleset.note: ABOLISH-V NOTES: Member of Vncls remove-10.1. No Fncls. (from abolish.01-v)
ABOLITION-N NOTES: Roleset based on expansion parallel to WordNet eventive nouns. Framed by Claire. Corresponds to VerbNet class Remove-10.1, based on verb entry abolish.01. (from abolition.01-n)
